Here‚Äôs a PowerShell script that will scan drives **C:\**, **D:\**, and **E:\** for any files **created or modified in the last 12 hours**. It will output a list of file paths and timestamps for review:

```powershell
# Define the drives to scan
$drives = @("C:\", "D:\", "E:\")

# Define the time window (last 12 hours)
$cutoffTime = (Get-Date).AddHours(-12)

# Prepare a list to hold results
$recentFiles = @()

# Scan each drive
foreach ($drive in $drives) {
    if (Test-Path $drive) {
        try {
            $recentFiles += Get-ChildItem -Path $drive -Recurse -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue |
                Where-Object {
                    ($_.LastWriteTime -gt $cutoffTime) -or
                    ($_.CreationTime -gt $cutoffTime)
                } |
                Select-Object FullName, LastWriteTime, CreationTime
        } catch {
            Write-Host "Access denied or issue accessing $drive"
        }
    }
}

# Output the results
$recentFiles | Sort-Object LastWriteTime -Descending | Format-Table -AutoSize
```
